column1: The Contextual Turn: from Context-Aware to Context-Driven Recommender Systems

column8: Delft University of Technology & Radboud University

column1: A critical change has occurred in the status of context in recommender systems. In the past
column2: context has been considered 'additional evidence'. This past picture is at odds with many present application domains
column3: where user and item information is scarce. Such domains face continuous cold start conditions and must exploit session rather than user information. In this paper
column4: we describe the `Contextual Turn?: the move towards context-driven recommendation algorithms for which context is critical
column5: rather than additional. We cover application domains
column6: algorithms that promise to address the challenges of context-driven recommendation
column7: and the steps that the community has taken to tackle context-driven problems. Our goal is to point out the commonalities of context-driven problems
column8: and urge the community to address the overarching challenges that context-driven recommendation poses.
